alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 11:30PM CDT until June 15 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MONTAGUE AND WESTERN COOKE COUNTIES... At 1129 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Jo, moving southeast at 40 mph. At 1124 PM CDT, ping pong ball size hail was reported with this storm. Another severe thunderstorm was located near Leo moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Nocona, Muenster, St. Jo, Lake Nocona, Lake Muenster, Nocona Hills, Montague, Prairie Point, Leo, Rosston, Bulcher, Capps Corner, Illinois Bend, Bonita, Hood and Marysville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Texas.
